intro: Leucas pycnanthela, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grassland environments. Leucas pycnanthela is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
